natural.name: Thief
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Toxic
natural.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

natural.name: Venoshock
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.

natural.name: String shot
natural.description: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

natural.name: Agility
natural.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

natural.name: Baton pass
natural.description:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua-ring
* both the user's and target's effect of block, mean-look, and spider-web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus-energy or an activated lansat-berry
* gastro-acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech-seed
* being targeted by lock-on or mind-reader
* magnet-rise
* perish-song's counter
* power-trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.

natural.name: Bug bite
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

natural.name: Giga drain
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

natural.name: Morning sun
natural.description:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny-day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

natural.name: Rage powder
natural.description:
Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.

This effect takes priority over lightningrod and storm-drain.

If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Screech
natural.description: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.

natural.name: Signal beam
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

natural.name: Toxic spikes
natural.description:
Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field.  A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poison instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poison are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.

If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.

rapid-spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.

This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar.

Pokémon entering the field due to baton-pass are not affected by this effect.

The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Facade
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: Flash
machine.description: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: Frustration
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: Hidden power
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: Mega drain
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: Mimic
machine.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

machine.name: Natural gift
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

machine.name: Protect
machine.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Psywave
machine.description: Inflicts typeless damage between 50% and 150% of the user's level, selected at random in increments of 10%.

machine.name: Rage
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

machine.name: Reflect
machine.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: Rest
machine.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: Return
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: Round
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: Secret power
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

machine.name: Skill swap
machine.description:
User and target switch abilities.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder-guard, this move will fail.

machine.name: Sleep talk
machine.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

machine.name: Sludge bomb
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: Snore
machine.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Solarbeam
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny-day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Struggle bug
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: Substitute
machine.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: Sunny day
machine.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: Swagger
machine.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: Sweet scent
machine.description: Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: Swift
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: Take down
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Thief
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Toxic
machine.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: Venoshock
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: String shot
machine.description: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: Agility
machine.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: Baton pass
machine.description:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua-ring
* both the user's and target's effect of block, mean-look, and spider-web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus-energy or an activated lansat-berry
* gastro-acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech-seed
* being targeted by lock-on or mind-reader
* magnet-rise
* perish-song's counter
* power-trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.

machine.name: Bug bite
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

machine.name: Giga drain
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: Morning sun
machine.description:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny-day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

machine.name: Rage powder
machine.description:
Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.

This effect takes priority over lightningrod and storm-drain.

If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Screech
machine.description: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.

machine.name: Signal beam
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

machine.name: Toxic spikes
machine.description:
Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field.  A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poison instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poison are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.

If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.

rapid-spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.

This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar.

Pokémon entering the field due to baton-pass are not affected by this effect.

tutor.name: Foresight
tutor.description: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

tutor.name: Disable
tutor.description: Disables the target's last used move, preventing its use for 4–7 turns, selected at random, or until the target leaves the field.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed,  if its last used move has 0 PP remaining, or if it already has a move disabled, this move will fail.

tutor.name: Tackle
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: Supersonic
tutor.description: Confuse the target.

tutor.name: Confusion
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

tutor.name: Poisonpowder
tutor.description: Poisons the target.

tutor.name: Leech life
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

tutor.name: Stun spore
tutor.description: Paralyzes the target.

tutor.name: Psybeam
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

tutor.name: Zen headbutt
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: Sleep powder
tutor.description: Puts the target to sleep.

tutor.name: Poison fang
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to badly poison the target.

tutor.name: Psychic
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: Attract
tutor.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

tutor.name: Bide
tutor.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

tutor.name: Captivate
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

tutor.name: Curse
tutor.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

tutor.name: Double edge
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

tutor.name: Double team
tutor.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

tutor.name: Endure

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

tutor.name: Swagger
tutor.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

tutor.name: Sweet scent
tutor.description: Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.

tutor.name: Swift
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

tutor.name: Take down
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

tutor.name: Thief
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Toxic
tutor.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

tutor.name: Venoshock
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.

tutor.name: String shot
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

tutor.name: Agility
tutor.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

tutor.name: Baton pass
tutor.description:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua-ring
* both the user's and target's effect of block, mean-look, and spider-web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus-energy or an activated lansat-berry
* gastro-acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech-seed
* being targeted by lock-on or mind-reader
* magnet-rise
* perish-song's counter
* power-trick
* substitute; the doll's HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.

tutor.name: Bug bite
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

tutor.name: Giga drain
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

tutor.name: Morning sun
tutor.description:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny-day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

tutor.name: Rage powder
tutor.description:
Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.

This effect takes priority over lightningrod and storm-drain.

If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Screech
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.

tutor.name: Signal beam
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

tutor.name: Toxic spikes
tutor.description:
Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field.  A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poison instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poison are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.

If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.

rapid-spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.

This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar.

Pokémon entering the field due to baton-pass are not affected by this effect.

egg.name: Foresight
egg.description: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

egg.name: Disable
egg.description: Disables the target's last used move, preventing its use for 4–7 turns, selected at random, or until the target leaves the field.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed,  if its last used move has 0 PP remaining, or if it already has a move disabled, this move will fail.

egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: Supersonic
egg.description: Confuse the target.

egg.name: Confusion

egg.description: Poisons the target.

egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

egg.name: Stun spore
egg.description: Paralyzes the target.

egg.name: Psybeam
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

egg.name: Zen headbutt
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: Sleep powder
egg.description: Puts the target to sleep.

egg.name: Poison fang
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to badly poison the target.

egg.name: Psychic
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

egg.name: Attract
egg.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

egg.name: Bide
egg.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Captivate
egg.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

egg.name: Curse
egg.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

egg.name: Double edge
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: Double team
egg.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

egg.name: Endure
egg.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: Facade
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

egg.name: Flash
egg.description: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

egg.name: Frustration
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

egg.name: Hidden power
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

egg.name: Mega drain
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

egg.name: Mimic
egg.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

egg.name: Natural gift
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

egg.name: Protect
egg.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: Psywave
egg.description: Inflicts typeless damage between 50% and 150% of the user's level, selected at random in increments of 10%.

egg.name: Rage
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

egg.name: Reflect
egg.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

egg.name: Rest
egg.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

egg.name: Return
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

egg.name: Round
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

egg.name: Secret power
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

egg.name: Skill swap
egg.description:
User and target switch abilities.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder-guard, this move will fail.

egg.name: Sleep talk
egg.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

egg.name: Sludge bomb
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

egg.name: Snore
egg.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: Solarbeam
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny-day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Struggle bug
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.

egg.name: Substitute
egg.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

(Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

natural.name: Ice beam
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

natural.name: Icy wind
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

natural.name: Mega drain
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

natural.name: Mimic
natural.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

natural.name: Natural gift
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

natural.name: Payback
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

natural.name: Protect
natural.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Rage
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

natural.name: Rain dance
natural.description:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar-beam has half power.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift-swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry-skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects-effects, and Pokémon with rain-dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

natural.name: Reflect
natural.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

natural.name: Rest
natural.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

natural.name: Return
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

natural.name: Round
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

natural.name: Scald
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to burn the target.

natural.name: Secret power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

natural.name: Skull bash
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Defense by one stage.  User then charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Sleep talk
natural.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

natural.name: Sludge bomb
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

natural.name: Snore
natural.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Substitute
natural.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

natural.name: Surf
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.

natural.name: Swagger
natural.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

natural.name: Swords dance
natural.description: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

natural.name: Take down
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

natural.name: Thief
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Toxic
natural.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

natural.name: Venoshock
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.

natural.name: Water pulse
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

natural.name: Waterfall
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Whirlpool
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.

natural.name: Bind
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid-spin cancels this effect.

natural.name: Magic coat
natural.description:
The first non-damaging move targeting the user this turn that inflicts major status effect-effects, stat change, or trap effects will be reflected at its user.

defog, memento, and teeter-dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro-acid, leech-seed, swagger, worry-seed, and yawn are reflected.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

natural.name: Acupressure
natural.description:
Raises one of the target's stats by two stages.  The raised stat is chosen at random from any stats that can be raised by two stages.  If no stat is eligible, this move will fail.

If the target has a substitute, this move will have no effect, even if the user is the target.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

natural.name: Aqua ring
natural.description:
Restores 1/16 of the user's max HP at the end of each turn.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.

natural.name: Aurora beam
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Attack by one stage.

natural.name: Bubble
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

natural.name: Confuse ray
natural.description: Confuse the target.

natural.name: Haze
natural.description:
Removes stat, accuracy, and evasion modifiers from every Pokémon on the field.

This does not count as a stat reduction for the purposes of clear-body or white-smoke.

natural.name: Knock off
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky-hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.

natural.name: Mirror coat
natural.description:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a special move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Muddy water
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

natural.name: Rapid spin
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Removes leech-seed from the user, frees the user from bind, clamp, fire-spin, magma-storm, sand-tomb, whirlpool, and wrap, and clears spikes, stealth-rock, and toxic-spikes from the user's side of the field.  If this move misses or has no effect, its effect doesn't activate.

natural.name: Safeguard
natural.description:
Protects Pokémon on the user's side of the field from major status effects and confusion for five turns.  Does not cancel existing ailments.  This effect remains even if the user leaves the field.

If yawn is used while this move is in effect, it will immediately fail.

defog used by an opponent will end this effect.

This effect does not prevent the confusion caused by outrage, petal-dance, or thrash.

natural.name: Tickle
natural.description: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Acid
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Supersonic
machine.description: Confuse the target.

machine.name: Wrap
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid-spin cancels this effect.

machine.name: Toxic spikes
machine.description:
Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field.  A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poison instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poison are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.

If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.

rapid-spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.

This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar.

Pokémon entering the field due to baton-pass are not affected by this effect.

machine.name: Poison sting
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: Water gun
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Acid spray
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.

machine.name: Constrict
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: Poison jab
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: Barrier
machine.description: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.

machine.name: Screech
machine.description: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.

machine.name: Hex
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has a major status ailment-ailment, this move has double power.

machine.name: Wring out
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power directly relates to the target's relative remaining HP, given by `1 + 120 * current HP / max HP`, to a maximum of 121.

machine.name: Hydro pump
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Sludge wave
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: Attract
machine.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: Bide
machine.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Blizzard
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

During hail, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

machine.name: Brine
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has less than half its max HP remaining, this move has double power.

machine.name: Bubblebeam
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: Captivate
machine.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

machine.name: Curse
machine.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

machine.name: Cut
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Dive
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User dives underwater for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, surf, and whirlpool still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Double edge
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Double team
machine.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: Endure
machine.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Facade
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: Frustration
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: Giga drain
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: Hail
machine.description:
Changes the weather to hail for five turns, during which non-ice Pokémon are damaged for 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.

If the user is holding icy-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

blizzard has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, blizzard has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with snow-cloak are exempt from this effect's damage.

    9 | water

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

machine.name: Sludge bomb
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: Snore
machine.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Substitute
machine.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: Surf
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: Swagger
machine.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: Swords dance
machine.description: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: Take down
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Thief
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Toxic
machine.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: Venoshock
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: Water pulse
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

machine.name: Waterfall
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Whirlpool
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: Bind
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid-spin cancels this effect.

machine.name: Magic coat
machine.description:
The first non-damaging move targeting the user this turn that inflicts major status effect-effects, stat change, or trap effects will be reflected at its user.

defog, memento, and teeter-dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro-acid, leech-seed, swagger, worry-seed, and yawn are reflected.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

machine.name: Acupressure
machine.description:
Raises one of the target's stats by two stages.  The raised stat is chosen at random from any stats that can be raised by two stages.  If no stat is eligible, this move will fail.

If the target has a substitute, this move will have no effect, even if the user is the target.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

machine.name: Aqua ring
machine.description:
Restores 1/16 of the user's max HP at the end of each turn.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.

machine.name: Aurora beam
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Attack by one stage.

machine.name: Bubble
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: Confuse ray
machine.description: Confuse the target.

machine.name: Haze
machine.description:
Removes stat, accuracy, and evasion modifiers from every Pokémon on the field.

This does not count as a stat reduction for the purposes of clear-body or white-smoke.

machine.name: Knock off
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky-hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.

machine.name: Mirror coat
machine.description:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a special move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Muddy water
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: Rapid spin
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Removes leech-seed from the user, frees the user from bind, clamp, fire-spin, magma-storm, sand-tomb, whirlpool, and wrap, and clears spikes, stealth-rock, and toxic-spikes from the user's side of the field.  If this move misses or has no effect, its effect doesn't activate.

machine.name: Safeguard
machine.description:
Protects Pokémon on the user's side of the field from major status effects and confusion for five turns.  Does not cancel existing ailments.  This effect remains even if the user leaves the field.

If yawn is used while this move is in effect, it will immediately fail.

defog used by an opponent will end this effect.

This effect does not prevent the confusion caused by outrage, petal-dance, or thrash.

machine.name: Tickle
machine.description: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: Supersonic
tutor.description: Confuse the target.

tutor.name: Toxic spikes
tutor.description:
Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field.  A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poison instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poison are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.

If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.

rapid-spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.

This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar.

Pokémon entering the field due to baton-pass are not affected by this effect.

tutor.name: Poison sting
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

tutor.name: Water gun
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: Acid spray
