Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

tutor.name: Rock slide
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: Role play
tutor.description:
User's ability is replaced with the target's until the user leaves the field.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If the target has flower-gift, forecast, illusion, imposter, multitype, stance-change, trace, wonder-guard, or zen-mode, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

natural.name: Peck
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Growl
natural.description: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

natural.name: Leer
natural.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Fury attack
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

natural.name: Mirror move
natural.description:
Uses the last move targeted at the user by a Pokémon still on the field.  A move counts as targeting the user even if it hit multiple Pokémon, as long as the user was one of them; however, moves targeting the field itself do not count.  If the user has not been targeted by an appropriate move since entering the field, or if no Pokémon that targeted the user remains on the field, this move will fail.

Moves that fail, miss, had no effect, or were block are still copied.

Assist moves, time-delayed moves, “meta” moves that operate on other moves/Pokémon/abilities, and some other special moves cannot be copied and are ignored; if the last move to hit the user was such a move, the previous move will be used instead.  The full list of ignored moves is: acupressure, assist, chatter, copycat, counter, curse, doom-desire, feint, focus-punch, future-sight, helping-hand, magic-coat, me-first, metronome, mimic, mirror-coat, mirror-move, nature-power, perish-song, psych-up, role-play, sketch, sleep-talk, snatch, spit-up, struggle, and transform.

This move cannot be selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk, nor forced by encore.

natural.name: Aerial ace
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

natural.name: Pursuit
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target attempts to switch out this turn before the user acts, this move hits the target before it leaves and has double power.

This effect can still hit a Pokémon that switches out when it has a substitute up or when an ally has used follow-me.

natural.name: Assurance
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target takes damage this turn for any reason before this move is used, this move has double power.

natural.name: Drill peck
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Roost
natural.description: Heals the user for half its max HP.  If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.

natural.name: Agility
natural.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

natural.name: Attract
natural.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

natural.name: Bide
natural.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Captivate
natural.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

natural.name: Curse
natural.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

natural.name: Defog
natural.description:
Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.  Clears away fog.  Removes the effects of mist, light-screen, reflect, safeguard, spikes, stealth-rock, and toxic-spikes from the target's side of the field.

If the target is protected by mist, it will prevent the evasion change, then be removed by this move.

natural.name: Detect
natural.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Double edge
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

natural.name: Double team
natural.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

natural.name: Echoed voice
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If any friendly Pokémon used this move earlier this turn or on the previous turn, that use's power is added to this move's power, to a maximum of 200.

natural.name: Endure
natural.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Facade
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

natural.name: Fly
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User flies high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky-uppercut, smack-down, thunder, twister, and whirlwind still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Frustration
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

natural.name: Hidden power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

natural.name: Mimic
natural.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

natural.name: Mud slap
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

natural.name: Natural gift
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

natural.name: Pluck
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

natural.name: Protect
natural.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Rage
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

natural.name: Rain dance
natural.description:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar-beam has half power.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift-swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry-skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects-effects, and Pokémon with rain-dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

natural.name: Razor wind
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Rest
natural.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

natural.name: Return
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

natural.name: Round
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

natural.name: Secret power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

natural.name: Sky attack
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.  Critical hit chance-chance is one level higher than normal.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Sleep talk
natural.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

natural.name: Snore
natural.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Steel wing
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense one stage.

natural.name: Substitute
natural.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

natural.name: Sunny day
natural.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

natural.name: Swagger
natural.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

natural.name: Swift
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

natural.name: Take down
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

natural.name: Thief
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Toxic
natural.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

natural.name: U turn
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faint from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

natural.name: Whirlwind
natural.description:
Switch the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction-cups or under the effect of ingrain.

natural.name: Work up
natural.description: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

natural.name: Air cutter
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

natural.name: Drill run
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

natural.name: Heat wave
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

natural.name: Ominous wind
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

natural.name: Tailwind
natural.description: For the next three turns, all Pokémon on the user's side of the field have their original Speed doubled.  This effect remains if the user leaves the field.

natural.name: Twister
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make each target flinch.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, this move will hit with double power.

natural.name: Astonish
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: False swipe
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Will not reduce the target's HP below 1.

natural.name: Featherdance
natural.description: Lowers the target's Attack by two stages.

natural.name: Faint attack
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

natural.name: Quick attack
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Scary face
natural.description: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

natural.name: Tri attack
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.  One of these effects is selected at random; they do not each have independent chances to occur.

natural.name: Uproar
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Peck
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Growl
machine.description: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

machine.name: Leer
machine.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: Mimic
machine.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

machine.name: Mud slap
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: Natural gift
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

machine.name: Pluck
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

machine.name: Protect
machine.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Rage
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

machine.name: Rain dance
machine.description:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar-beam has half power.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift-swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry-skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects-effects, and Pokémon with rain-dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: Razor wind
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Rest
machine.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: Return
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: Round
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: Secret power
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

machine.name: Sky attack
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.  Critical hit chance-chance is one level higher than normal.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Sleep talk
machine.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

machine.name: Snore
machine.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Steel wing
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense one stage.

machine.name: Substitute
machine.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: Sunny day
machine.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: Swagger
machine.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: Swift
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: Take down
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Thief
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Toxic
machine.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: U turn
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faint from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: Whirlwind
machine.description:
Switch the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction-cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: Work up
machine.description: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

machine.name: Air cutter
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: Drill run
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: Heat wave
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: Ominous wind
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

machine.name: Tailwind
machine.description: For the next three turns, all Pokémon on the user's side of the field have their original Speed doubled.  This effect remains if the user leaves the field.

machine.name: Twister
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make each target flinch.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: Astonish
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: False swipe
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Will not reduce the target's HP below 1.

machine.name: Featherdance
machine.description: Lowers the target's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: Faint attack
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: Quick attack
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Scary face
machine.description: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: Tri attack
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.  One of these effects is selected at random; they do not each have independent chances to occur.

machine.name: Uproar
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

tutor.name: Peck
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: Growl
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

tutor.name: Leer
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: Fury attack
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

tutor.name: Mirror move
tutor.description:
Uses the last move targeted at the user by a Pokémon still on the field.  A move counts as targeting the user even if it hit multiple Pokémon, as long as the user was one of them; however, moves targeting the field itself do not count.  If the user has not been targeted by an appropriate move since entering the field, or if no Pokémon that targeted the user remains on the field, this move will fail.

Moves that fail, miss, had no effect, or were block are still copied.

Assist moves, time-delayed moves, “meta” moves that operate on other moves/Pokémon/abilities, and some other special moves cannot be copied and are ignored; if the last move to hit the user was such a move, the previous move will be used instead.  The full list of ignored moves is: acupressure, assist, chatter, copycat, counter, curse, doom-desire, feint, focus-punch, future-sight, helping-hand, magic-coat, me-first, metronome, mimic, mirror-coat, mirror-move, nature-power, perish-song, psych-up, role-play, sketch, sleep-talk, snatch, spit-up, struggle, and transform.

This move cannot be selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk, nor forced by encore.

tutor.name: Aerial ace
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

tutor.name: Pursuit
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target attempts to switch out this turn before the user acts, this move hits the target before it leaves and has double power.

This effect can still hit a Pokémon that switches out when it has a substitute up or when an ally has used follow-me.

tutor.name: Assurance
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target takes damage this turn for any reason before this move is used, this move has double power.

tutor.name: Drill peck
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: Roost
tutor.description: Heals the user for half its max HP.  If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.

tutor.name: Agility
tutor.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

tutor.name: Attract
tutor.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

tutor.name: Bide
tutor.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

tutor.name: Captivate
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

tutor.name: Curse
tutor.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

tutor.name: Defog
tutor.description:
Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.  Clears away fog.  Removes the effects of mist, light-screen, reflect, safeguard, spikes, stealth-rock, and toxic-spikes from the target's side of the field.

If the target is protected by mist, it will prevent the evasion change, then be removed by this move.

tutor.name: Detect
tutor.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

* acupressure from an ally

* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Double edge
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

tutor.name: Double team
tutor.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

tutor.name: Echoed voice
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If any friendly Pokémon used this move earlier this turn or on the previous turn, that use's power is added to this move's power, to a maximum of 200.

tutor.name: Endure
tutor.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Facade
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

tutor.name: Fly
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User flies high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky-uppercut, smack-down, thunder, twister, and whirlwind still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

tutor.name: Frustration
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

tutor.name: Hidden power
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

tutor.name: Sunny day
tutor.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

tutor.name: Swagger
tutor.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

tutor.name: Swift
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

tutor.name: Take down
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

tutor.name: Thief
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Toxic
tutor.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

tutor.name: U turn
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faint from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

tutor.name: Whirlwind
tutor.description:
Switch the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction-cups or under the effect of ingrain.

tutor.name: Work up
tutor.description: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

tutor.name: Air cutter
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

tutor.name: Drill run
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

tutor.name: Heat wave
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

tutor.name: Ominous wind
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

tutor.name: Tailwind
tutor.description: For the next three turns, all Pokémon on the user's side of the field have their original Speed doubled.  This effect remains if the user leaves the field.

tutor.name: Twister
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make each target flinch.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, this move will hit with double power.

tutor.name: Astonish
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: False swipe
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Will not reduce the target's HP below 1.

tutor.name: Featherdance
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Attack by two stages.

tutor.name: Faint attack
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

tutor.name: Quick attack
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: Scary face
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

tutor.name: Tri attack
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.  One of these effects is selected at random; they do not each have independent chances to occur.

tutor.name: Uproar
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Peck
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: Growl
egg.description: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

egg.name: Leer
egg.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: Fury attack
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

egg.name: Mirror move
egg.description:
Uses the last move targeted at the user by a Pokémon still on the field.  A move counts as targeting the user even if it hit multiple Pokémon, as long as the user was one of them; however, moves targeting the field itself do not count.  If the user has not been targeted by an appropriate move since entering the field, or if no Pokémon that targeted the user remains on the field, this move will fail.

Moves that fail, miss, had no effect, or were block are still copied.

Assist moves, time-delayed moves, “meta” moves that operate on other moves/Pokémon/abilities, and some other special moves cannot be copied and are ignored; if the last move to hit the user was such a move, the previous move will be used instead.  The full list of ignored moves is: acupressure, assist, chatter, copycat, counter, curse, doom-desire, feint, focus-punch, future-sight, helping-hand, magic-coat, me-first, metronome, mimic, mirror-coat, mirror-move, nature-power, perish-song, psych-up, role-play, sketch, sleep-talk, snatch, spit-up, struggle, and transform.

This move cannot be selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk, nor forced by encore.

egg.name: Aerial ace
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

egg.name: Pursuit
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target attempts to switch out this turn before the user acts, this move hits the target before it leaves and has double power.

This effect can still hit a Pokémon that switches out when it has a substitute up or when an ally has used follow-me.

egg.name: Assurance
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target takes damage this turn for any reason before this move is used, this move has double power.

egg.name: Drill peck
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: Roost
egg.description: Heals the user for half its max HP.  If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.

egg.name: Agility
egg.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

egg.name: Attract
egg.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

egg.name: Bide
egg.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Captivate
egg.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

egg.name: Curse
egg.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

egg.name: Defog
egg.description:
Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.  Clears away fog.  Removes the effects of mist, light-screen, reflect, safeguard, spikes, stealth-rock, and toxic-spikes from the target's side of the field.

If the target is protected by mist, it will prevent the evasion change, then be removed by this move.

egg.name: Detect
egg.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: Double edge
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: Double team
egg.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

egg.name: Echoed voice
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If any friendly Pokémon used this move earlier this turn or on the previous turn, that use's power is added to this move's power, to a maximum of 200.

egg.name: Endure
egg.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: Facade
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

egg.name: Fly
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User flies high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky-uppercut, smack-down, thunder, twister, and whirlwind still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Frustration
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

egg.name: Hidden power
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

egg.name: Mimic
egg.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

egg.name: Mud slap
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

egg.name: Natural gift
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

egg.name: Pluck
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

egg.name: Protect
egg.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: Rage
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

egg.name: Rain dance
egg.description:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar-beam has half power.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift-swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry-skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects-effects, and Pokémon with rain-dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

egg.name: Razor wind
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Rest
egg.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

egg.name: Return
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

egg.name: Round
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

egg.name: Secret power
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

egg.name: Sky attack
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.  Critical hit chance-chance is one level higher than normal.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Sleep talk
egg.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

egg.name: Snore
egg.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: Steel wing
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense one stage.

egg.name: Substitute
