natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Hidden power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

natural.name: Icy wind
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

natural.name: Incinerate
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, it's destroyed and cannot be used in response to this move.

natural.name: Iron tail
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Mimic
natural.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

natural.name: Mud slap
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

natural.name: Natural gift
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

natural.name: Payback
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

natural.name: Poison jab
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

natural.name: Protect
natural.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Rage
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

natural.name: Rain dance
natural.description:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar-beam has half power.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift-swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry-skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects-effects, and Pokémon with rain-dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

natural.name: Rest
natural.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

natural.name: Return
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

natural.name: Roar
natural.description:
Switch the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction-cups or under the effect of ingrain.

natural.name: Rock climb
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

natural.name: Rock polish
natural.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

natural.name: Rock slide
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Rock smash
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Rock tomb
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

natural.name: Rollout
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense-curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

natural.name: Round
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

natural.name: Sandstorm
natural.description:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar-beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

natural.name: Secret power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

natural.name: Shock wave
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

natural.name: Skull bash
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Defense by one stage.  User then charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Sleep talk
natural.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

natural.name: Snore
natural.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Stealth rock
natural.description:
Spreads sharp rocks around the opposing field, damaging any Pokémon that enters the field for 1/8 its max HP.  This damage is affected by the entering Pokémon's susceptibility to rock moves.

rapid-spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.

natural.name: Strength
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Substitute
natural.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

natural.name: Sunny day
natural.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

natural.name: Swagger
natural.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

natural.name: Thief
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Thunder
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During rain-dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

During sunny-day, this move has 50% accuracy.

natural.name: Thunderbolt
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

natural.name: Toxic
natural.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

natural.name: Zap cannon
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.

natural.name: Ancientpower
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

natural.name: Aqua tail
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Earth power
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Endeavor
natural.description: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.

natural.name: Flamethrower
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

natural.name: Ice beam
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

natural.name: Spite
natural.description: Lowers the PP of the target's last used move by 4.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if its last used move has 0 PP remaining, this move will fail.

natural.name: Superpower
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

natural.name: Uproar
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Counter
natural.description:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a physical move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Crunch
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Crush claw
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Dragon rush
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Fire fang
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Ice fang
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Magnitude
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is selected at random between 10 and 150, with an average of 71:

Magnitude | Power | Chance
--------: | ----: | -----:
        4 |    10 |     5%
        5 |    30 |    10%
        6 |    50 |    20%
        7 |    70 |    30%
        8 |    90 |    20%
        9 |   110 |    10%
       10 |   150 |     5%

This move has double power against Pokémon currently underground due to dig.

natural.name: Pursuit
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target attempts to switch out this turn before the user acts, this move hits the target before it leaves and has double power.

This effect can still hit a Pokémon that switches out when it has a substitute up or when an ally has used follow-me.

natural.name: Reversal
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.

64 * current HP / max HP | Power
-----------------------: | ----:
 0– 1                    |  200
 2– 5                    |  150
 6–12                    |  100
13–21                    |   80
22–42                    |   40
43–64                    |   20

natural.name: Swords dance
natural.description: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

natural.name: Thrash
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

natural.name: Thunder fang
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Horn attack
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Rock blast
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

machine.name: Bulldoze
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: Stomp
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

machine.name: Scary face
machine.description: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: Chip away
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage calculation ignores the target's stat modifiers, including evasion.

machine.name: Tail whip
machine.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Fury attack
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

machine.name: Drill run
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: Stone edge
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: Horn drill
machine.description:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

machine.name: Leer
machine.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Take down
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Megahorn
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Attract
machine.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: Bide
machine.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Blizzard
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

During hail, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

machine.name: Body slam
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: Captivate
machine.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

machine.name: Curse
machine.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

machine.name: Dig
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Double edge
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Double team
machine.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: Dragon pulse
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Earthquake
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: Endure
machine.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Facade
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: Fire blast
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: Fissure
machine.description:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

machine.name: Rest
machine.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: Return
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: Roar
machine.description:
Switch the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction-cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: Rock climb
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

machine.name: Rock polish
machine.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: Rock slide
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Rock smash
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Rock tomb
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: Rollout
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense-curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

machine.name: Round
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: Sandstorm
machine.description:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar-beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

machine.name: Secret power
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

machine.name: Shock wave
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: Skull bash
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Defense by one stage.  User then charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Sleep talk
machine.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

machine.name: Snore
machine.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Stealth rock
machine.description:
Spreads sharp rocks around the opposing field, damaging any Pokémon that enters the field for 1/8 its max HP.  This damage is affected by the entering Pokémon's susceptibility to rock moves.

rapid-spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.

machine.name: Strength
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Substitute
machine.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: Sunny day
machine.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: Swagger
machine.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: Thief
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Thunder
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During rain-dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

During sunny-day, this move has 50% accuracy.

machine.name: Thunderbolt
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: Toxic
machine.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: Zap cannon
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: Ancientpower
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

machine.name: Aqua tail
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Earth power
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Endeavor
machine.description: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.

machine.name: Flamethrower
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: Ice beam
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

machine.name: Spite
machine.description: Lowers the PP of the target's last used move by 4.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if its last used move has 0 PP remaining, this move will fail.

machine.name: Superpower
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: Uproar
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Counter
machine.description:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a physical move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Crunch
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Crush claw
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Dragon rush
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Fire fang
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Ice fang
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Magnitude
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is selected at random between 10 and 150, with an average of 71:

Magnitude | Power | Chance
--------: | ----: | -----:
        4 |    10 |     5%
        5 |    30 |    10%
        6 |    50 |    20%
        7 |    70 |    30%
        8 |    90 |    20%
        9 |   110 |    10%
       10 |   150 |     5%

This move has double power against Pokémon currently underground due to dig.

machine.name: Pursuit
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target attempts to switch out this turn before the user acts, this move hits the target before it leaves and has double power.

This effect can still hit a Pokémon that switches out when it has a substitute up or when an ally has used follow-me.

machine.name: Reversal
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.

64 * current HP / max HP | Power
-----------------------: | ----:
 0– 1                    |  200
 2– 5                    |  150
 6–12                    |  100
13–21                    |   80
22–42                    |   40
43–64                    |   20

machine.name: Swords dance
machine.description: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: Thrash
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

machine.name: Thunder fang
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

tutor.name: Bulldoze
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

tutor.name: Stomp

Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

tutor.name: Scary face
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

tutor.name: Chip away
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage calculation ignores the target's stat modifiers, including evasion.

tutor.name: Tail whip
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: Fury attack
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

tutor.name: Drill run
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

tutor.name: Stone edge
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

tutor.name: Horn drill
tutor.description:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

tutor.name: Leer
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: Take down
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

tutor.name: Megahorn
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: Attract
tutor.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

tutor.name: Bide
tutor.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

tutor.name: Blizzard
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

During hail, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

tutor.name: Body slam
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

tutor.name: Captivate
tutor.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

tutor.name: Curse
tutor.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

tutor.name: Dig
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

tutor.name: Double edge
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

tutor.name: Double team
tutor.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

tutor.name: Dragon pulse
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: Earthquake
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

tutor.name: Endure
tutor.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Facade
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

tutor.name: Fire blast
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

tutor.name: Fissure
tutor.description:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

tutor.name: Frustration
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

tutor.name: Headbutt
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: Hidden power
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

tutor.name: Icy wind
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

tutor.name: Incinerate
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, it's destroyed and cannot be used in response to this move.

tutor.name: Iron tail
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: Mimic
tutor.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

tutor.name: Mud slap
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

tutor.name: Natural gift
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

tutor.name: Payback
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

tutor.name: Poison jab
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

tutor.name: Protect
tutor.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Rage
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

Spreads sharp rocks around the opposing field, damaging any Pokémon that enters the field for 1/8 its max HP.  This damage is affected by the entering Pokémon's susceptibility to rock moves.

rapid-spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.

tutor.name: Strength
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: Substitute
tutor.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

tutor.name: Sunny day
tutor.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

tutor.name: Swagger
tutor.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

tutor.name: Thief
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Thunder
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During rain-dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

During sunny-day, this move has 50% accuracy.

tutor.name: Thunderbolt
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

tutor.name: Toxic
tutor.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

tutor.name: Zap cannon
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.

tutor.name: Ancientpower
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

tutor.name: Aqua tail
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: Earth power
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: Endeavor
tutor.description: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.

tutor.name: Flamethrower
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

tutor.name: Ice beam
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

tutor.name: Spite
tutor.description: Lowers the PP of the target's last used move by 4.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if its last used move has 0 PP remaining, this move will fail.

tutor.name: Superpower
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

tutor.name: Uproar
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

tutor.name: Counter
tutor.description:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a physical move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Crunch
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: Crush claw
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: Dragon rush
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: Fire fang
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: Ice fang
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: Magnitude
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is selected at random between 10 and 150, with an average of 71:

Magnitude | Power | Chance
--------: | ----: | -----:
        4 |    10 |     5%
        5 |    30 |    10%
        6 |    50 |    20%
        7 |    70 |    30%
        8 |    90 |    20%
        9 |   110 |    10%
       10 |   150 |     5%

This move has double power against Pokémon currently underground due to dig.

tutor.name: Pursuit
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target attempts to switch out this turn before the user acts, this move hits the target before it leaves and has double power.

This effect can still hit a Pokémon that switches out when it has a substitute up or when an ally has used follow-me.

tutor.name: Reversal
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.

64 * current HP / max HP | Power
-----------------------: | ----:
 0– 1                    |  200
 2– 5                    |  150
 6–12                    |  100
13–21                    |   80
22–42                    |   40
43–64                    |   20

tutor.name: Swords dance
tutor.description: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

tutor.name: Thrash
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

tutor.name: Thunder fang
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: Horn attack
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: Rock blast
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

egg.name: Bulldoze
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

egg.name: Stomp
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

egg.name: Scary face
egg.description: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

egg.name: Chip away
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage calculation ignores the target's stat modifiers, including evasion.

egg.name: Tail whip
egg.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: Fury attack
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

egg.name: Drill run
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

egg.name: Stone edge
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

egg.name: Horn drill
egg.description:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

egg.name: Leer
egg.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: Take down
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: Megahorn
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: Attract
egg.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

egg.name: Bide
egg.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Blizzard
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

During hail, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

egg.name: Body slam
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

egg.name: Captivate
egg.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

egg.name: Curse
egg.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

egg.name: Dig
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Double edge
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: Double team
egg.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

egg.name: Dragon pulse
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: Earthquake
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

egg.name: Endure
egg.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: Facade
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

egg.name: Fire blast
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

egg.name: Fissure
egg.description:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

egg.name: Frustration
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

egg.name: Headbutt
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: Hidden power
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

egg.name: Icy wind
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

egg.name: Incinerate
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, it's destroyed and cannot be used in response to this move.

egg.name: Iron tail
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: Mimic
egg.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

egg.name: Mud slap
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

egg.name: Natural gift
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

egg.name: Payback
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

egg.name: Poison jab
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

egg.name: Protect
egg.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: Rage
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

egg.name: Rain dance
egg.description:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar-beam has half power.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift-swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry-skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects-effects, and Pokémon with rain-dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

egg.name: Rest
egg.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

egg.name: Return
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

egg.name: Roar
egg.description:
Switch the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction-cups or under the effect of ingrain.

egg.name: Rock climb
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

egg.name: Rock polish
egg.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

egg.name: Rock slide
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: Rock smash
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: Rock tomb
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

egg.name: Rollout
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense-curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

egg.name: Round
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

egg.name: Sandstorm
egg.description:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar-beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

egg.name: Secret power
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

egg.name: Shock wave
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

egg.name: Skull bash
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Defense by one stage.  User then charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Sleep talk
egg.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

egg.name: Snore
egg.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
