tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User bounces high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky-uppercut, smack-down, thunder, and twister still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

tutor.name: Covet
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Endeavor
tutor.description: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.

tutor.name: Flamethrower
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

tutor.name: Gravity
tutor.description:
For five turns (including this one), all immunities to ground moves are disabled.  For the duration of this effect, the evasion of every Pokémon on the field is lowered by two stages.  Cancels the effects of bounce, fly, and sky-drop.

Specifically, flying Pokémon and those with levitate or that have used magnet-rise are no longer immune to ground attacks, arena-trap, spikes, or toxic-spikes.

bounce, fly, sky-drop, high-jump-kick, jump-kick, and splash cannot be used while this move is in effect.

*Bug*: If this move is used during a double or triple battle while Pokémon are under the effect of sky-drop, Sky Drop's effect is not correctly canceled on its target, and it remains high in the air indefinitely.  As Sky Drop prevents the target from acting, the only way to subsequently remove it from the field is to faint it.

tutor.name: Heal bell
tutor.description: Removes major status effects-effects and confusion from every Pokémon in the user's party.

tutor.name: Helping hand
tutor.description:
Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: Hyper voice
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.

tutor.name: Icy wind
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

tutor.name: Knock off
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky-hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.

tutor.name: Last resort
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  This move can only be used if each of the user's other moves has been used at least once since the user entered the field.  If this is the user's only move, this move will fail.

tutor.name: Magic coat
tutor.description:
The first non-damaging move targeting the user this turn that inflicts major status effect-effects, stat change, or trap effects will be reflected at its user.

defog, memento, and teeter-dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro-acid, leech-seed, swagger, worry-seed, and yawn are reflected.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

tutor.name: Magic room
tutor.description: For five turns (including this one), passive effects of held items are ignored, and Pokémon will not use their held items.

tutor.name: Pain split
tutor.description:
Changes the user's and target's remaining HP to the average of their current remaining HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect does not count as inflicting damage for other moves and effects that respond to damage taken.

This effect fail against a substitute.

tutor.name: Role play
tutor.description:
User's ability is replaced with the target's until the user leaves the field.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If the target has flower-gift, forecast, illusion, imposter, multitype, stance-change, trace, wonder-guard, or zen-mode, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

natural.name: Thundershock
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

natural.name: Growl
natural.description: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

natural.name: Tail whip
natural.description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Thunder wave
natural.description: Paralyzes the target.

natural.name: Quick attack
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Electro ball
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  The greater the user's Speed compared to the target's, the higher power this move has, to a maximum of 150.

User's Speed                     | Power
-------------------------------- | ----:
Up to 2× the target's Speed      |    60
Up to 3× the target's Speed      |    80
Up to 4× the target's Speed      |   120
More than 4× the target's Speed  |   150

natural.name: Slam
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Swift
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

natural.name: Feint
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the effects of detect or protect from the target before hitting.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Agility
natural.description: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

natural.name: Discharge
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

natural.name: Thunder
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During rain-dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

During sunny-day, this move has 50% accuracy.

natural.name: Light screen
natural.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from special attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

natural.name: Attract
natural.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

natural.name: Bide
natural.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Body slam
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

natural.name: Brick break
natural.description: Destroys any light-screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.  The barriers are destroyed even if this move has no effect.

natural.name: Captivate
natural.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

natural.name: Charge beam
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 70% chance to raise the user's Special Attack by one stage.

natural.name: Curse
natural.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

natural.name: Defense curl
natural.description:
Raises user's Defense by one stage.

After this move is used, the power of ice-ball and rollout are doubled until the user leaves the field.

natural.name: Detect
natural.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Dig
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Double edge
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

natural.name: Double team
natural.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

natural.name: Dynamicpunch
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to confuse the target.

natural.name: Echoed voice
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If any friendly Pokémon used this move earlier this turn or on the previous turn, that use's power is added to this move's power, to a maximum of 200.

natural.name: Endure
natural.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Facade
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

natural.name: Flash
natural.description: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

natural.name: Fling
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky-hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

natural.name: Focus punch
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the user takes damage this turn before hitting, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

natural.name: Frustration
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

natural.name: Grass knot
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

natural.name: Headbutt
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Hidden power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

natural.name: Iron tail
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Mega kick
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Mega punch
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Mimic
natural.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

natural.name: Mud slap
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

natural.name: Natural gift
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

natural.name: Pay day
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  After the battle ends, the winner receives five times the user's level in extra money for each time this move was used.

natural.name: Protect
natural.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Rage
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

natural.name: Rain dance
natural.description:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar-beam has half power.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift-swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry-skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects-effects, and Pokémon with rain-dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

natural.name: Reflect
natural.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

natural.name: Rest
natural.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

natural.name: Return
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

natural.name: Rock smash
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Rollout
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense-curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

natural.name: Round
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

natural.name: Secret power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

natural.name: Seismic toss
natural.description: Inflicts damage equal to the user's level.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

natural.name: Shock wave
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

natural.name: Skull bash
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Defense by one stage.  User then charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Sleep talk
natural.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

natural.name: Snore
natural.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Strength
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Submission
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

natural.name: Substitute
natural.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

natural.name: Swagger
natural.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

natural.name: Take down
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

natural.name: Thunderpunch
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

natural.name: Thunderbolt
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

natural.name: Toxic
natural.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

natural.name: Volt switch
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faint from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

natural.name: Wild charge
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

natural.name: Zap cannon
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.

natural.name: Counter
natural.description:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a physical move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Covet
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Helping hand
natural.description:
Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Knock off
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky-hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.

natural.name: Magnet rise
natural.description:
For five turns, the user is immune to ground moves.

If the user is under the effect of ingrain or has levitate, this move will fail.

This effect is temporarily disabled by and cannot be used during gravity.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.

natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

machine.name: Defense curl
machine.description:
Raises user's Defense by one stage.

After this move is used, the power of ice-ball and rollout are doubled until the user leaves the field.

machine.name: Detect
machine.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Dig
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Double edge
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Double team
machine.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: Dynamicpunch
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to confuse the target.

machine.name: Echoed voice
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If any friendly Pokémon used this move earlier this turn or on the previous turn, that use's power is added to this move's power, to a maximum of 200.

machine.name: Endure
machine.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Facade
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: Flash
machine.description: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: Fling
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky-hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: Focus punch
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the user takes damage this turn before hitting, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

machine.name: Frustration
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: Grass knot
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: Headbutt
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Hidden power
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: Iron tail
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Mega kick
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Mega punch
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Mimic
machine.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

machine.name: Mud slap
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: Natural gift
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

machine.name: Pay day
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  After the battle ends, the winner receives five times the user's level in extra money for each time this move was used.

machine.name: Protect
machine.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Rage
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

machine.name: Rain dance
machine.description:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar-beam has half power.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift-swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry-skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects-effects, and Pokémon with rain-dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: Reflect
machine.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: Rest
machine.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: Return
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: Rock smash
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Rollout
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense-curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

machine.name: Round
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: Secret power
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

machine.name: Seismic toss
machine.description: Inflicts damage equal to the user's level.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

machine.name: Shock wave
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: Skull bash
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Defense by one stage.  User then charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Sleep talk
machine.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

machine.name: Snore
machine.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Strength
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Submission
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Substitute
machine.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: Swagger
machine.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: Take down
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Thunderpunch
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: Thunderbolt
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: Toxic
machine.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: Volt switch
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faint from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: Wild charge
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Zap cannon
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: Counter
machine.description:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a physical move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Covet
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Helping hand
machine.description:
Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Knock off
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky-hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.

machine.name: Magnet rise
machine.description:
For five turns, the user is immune to ground moves.

If the user is under the effect of ingrain or has levitate, this move will fail.

This effect is temporarily disabled by and cannot be used during gravity.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.

machine.name: Signal beam
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

tutor.name: Substitute
tutor.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

natural.name: Hidden power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

natural.description:
For five turns (including this one), all immunities to ground moves are disabled.  For the duration of this effect, the evasion of every Pokémon on the field is lowered by two stages.  Cancels the effects of bounce, fly, and sky-drop.

Specifically, flying Pokémon and those with levitate or that have used magnet-rise are no longer immune to ground attacks, arena-trap, spikes, or toxic-spikes.

bounce, fly, sky-drop, high-jump-kick, jump-kick, and splash cannot be used while this move is in effect.

*Bug*: If this move is used during a double or triple battle while Pokémon are under the effect of sky-drop, Sky Drop's effect is not correctly canceled on its target, and it remains high in the air indefinitely.  As Sky Drop prevents the target from acting, the only way to subsequently remove it from the field is to faint it.

natural.name: Low kick
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

natural.name: Synthesis
natural.description:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny-day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

natural.name: Worry seed
natural.description:
Changes the target's ability to insomnia.

If the target's ability is truant or multitype, this move will fail.

natural.name: Zen headbutt
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Seed bomb
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Confusion
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

machine.name: Barrage
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

machine.name: Hypnosis
machine.description: Puts the target to sleep.

machine.name: Psyshock
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage calculation always uses the target's Defense, regardless of this move's damage class.

machine.name: Stomp
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

machine.name: Wood hammer
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Leaf storm
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.

machine.name: Attract
machine.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: Bide
machine.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Bullet seed
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

machine.name: Captivate
machine.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

machine.name: Curse
machine.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

machine.name: Double edge
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Double team
machine.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: Dream eater
machine.description: Fails if not used on a sleep Pokémon.  Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: Egg bomb
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Endure
machine.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Energy ball
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Explosion
machine.description: User faint, even if the attack fail or miss.  Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Facade
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: Flash
machine.description: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: Frustration
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: Giga drain
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: Giga impact
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: Grass knot
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: Headbutt
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Hidden power
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: Hyper beam
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: Light screen
machine.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from special attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: Mega drain
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: Mimic
machine.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

machine.name: Natural gift
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

machine.name: Nightmare
machine.description: Only works on sleep Pokémon.  Gives the target a nightmare, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.  If the target wakes up or leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: Protect
machine.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Psych up
machine.description:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

machine.name: Psychic
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Psywave
machine.description: Inflicts typeless damage between 50% and 150% of the user's level, selected at random in increments of 10%.

machine.name: Rage
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

machine.name: Reflect
machine.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: Rest
machine.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: Return
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: Rollout
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense-curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

machine.name: Round
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: Secret power
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

machine.name: Selfdestruct
machine.description: User faint, even if the attack fail or miss.  Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Skill swap
machine.description:
User and target switch abilities.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder-guard, this move will fail.

machine.name: Sleep talk
machine.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

machine.name: Sludge bomb
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: Snore
machine.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Solarbeam
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny-day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Strength
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Substitute
machine.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: Sunny day
machine.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: Swagger
machine.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: Swords dance
machine.description: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: Take down
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Telekinesis
machine.description:
For three turns (including this one), moves used against the target have 100% accuracy, but the target is immune to ground damage.  Accuracy of one-hit KO moves is exempt from this effect.

This effect is removed by gravity.  If Gravity is already in effect, this move will fail.

machine.name: Teleport
machine.description: Does nothing.  Wild battles end immediately.

machine.name: Thief
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Toxic
machine.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: Trick room
machine.description:
For five turns (including this one), slower Pokémon will act before faster Pokémon.  Move priority is not affected.  Using this move when its effect is already active will end the effect.

Pokémon holding full-incense, lagging-tail, or quick-claw and Pokémon with stall ignore this effect.

machine.name: Ancientpower
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

machine.name: Block
machine.description:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton-pass, u-turn, or a shed-shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton-pass.

machine.name: Gravity
machine.description:
For five turns (including this one), all immunities to ground moves are disabled.  For the duration of this effect, the evasion of every Pokémon on the field is lowered by two stages.  Cancels the effects of bounce, fly, and sky-drop.

Specifically, flying Pokémon and those with levitate or that have used magnet-rise are no longer immune to ground attacks, arena-trap, spikes, or toxic-spikes.

bounce, fly, sky-drop, high-jump-kick, jump-kick, and splash cannot be used while this move is in effect.

*Bug*: If this move is used during a double or triple battle while Pokémon are under the effect of sky-drop, Sky Drop's effect is not correctly canceled on its target, and it remains high in the air indefinitely.  As Sky Drop prevents the target from acting, the only way to subsequently remove it from the field is to faint it.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

tutor.name: Protect

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

tutor.name: Substitute
tutor.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

natural.name: Hidden power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.
